derivation.yuyuan_name: late 18th cent. (in the sense 'eat or bite noisily'): probably imitative; compare with crunch

entry.tran: (挤压、压碎时)发出喀嚓声，发出嘎吱声
entry.def: If something scrunches, it makes a loud sound as it is pressed or crushed or as it presses or crushes something else.

example.ex: The sand on the floor scrunched under our feet...
example.tran: 地板上的沙子在我们脚下嘎吱作响。

example.ex: Her feet scrunch on the gravel.
example.tran: 她的脚喀嚓喀嚓地踩在沙砾上。

entry.tran: 挤扁;掰弯;使变形;使压碎
entry.def: If you scrunch something, you squeeze it or bend it so that it is no longer in its natural shape and is often crushed.

example.tran: 她父亲打歪了他的鼻子。

example.ex: Her mother was sitting bolt upright, scrunching her white cotton gloves into a ball.
example.tran: 她母亲坐得笔直，把她的白手套揉成了球状。
